title: Rendering Lists in React
content:
Hello, this is May.
In this post, we will learn how to render lists in React.
To render lists, we use the map function provided by JavaScript arrays.

comments.content: When you actually develop, it seems like you use the map function a lot. ğŸ˜„
After applying it, the code became really concise. Hehe
It seems like you have to put in a key for each item~
It feels like productivity is increasing a lot. Keke
Thank you for another great post today! ğŸ‘

title: Understanding Conditional Rendering in React
content:
Hello, this is ShibaChuchu.
In this post, let's learn about conditional rendering in React.
Conditional rendering means rendering differently depending on conditions.

comments.content: I didn't know there was a way to use it like this!
Thank you for the great post. Hehe
I've always used only ?, but now I should try && too.
Thank you for the easy explanation. ğŸ˜
I'll apply it directly to the code!!

title: Let's Learn about React Hooks
content:
Hello, this is PikaChuchu.
In this post, let's learn about React hooks.
Hooks are used to interfere with the flow of function components in React to perform various tasks.

comments.content: It was a difficult concept, but after reading the post, I feel like I've organized it a bit.
I wondered what a hook was, but it turned out to be this. Thank you for letting me know. Hehe
When I first encountered hooks, it was too difficult, but thank you! ğŸ‘
I think I can use it well in the future.
Hooks, which are difficult from the name... ğŸ¥²

title: Introduction to React Components
content:
In this post, I would like to explain about React components.
Even those who have studied React a little would know that React is based on components.
Then what exactly are components?

comments.content: It's nice to be able to understand the concept that was confusing. Keke
Thank you for the easy explanation about components. ğŸ‘
Thank you for helping me understand the concept better! ğŸ‘
React is component-based, so it's highly reusable and really great.
React is the best!! ğŸ‘

content:
